page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY Old Oswestry
page.content:
This is the finest Iron Age Hill fort in the Borderland country. It stands plateau like some one hundred feet above the countryside and covers fifty six acres in size.
The summit is flat and almost rectangular in shape aligned north east to south west. It is surrounded by large earth embankments and ditches in seven main circles. On its west side there are several hollows aligned east to west.
Views from the summit extend over the Shropshire Plain and Welsh Hills. The route of Watts Dyke can be observed as a small mound to the south and north.
